replies.msg:
1. Continuation of CityU-Learning. Online teaching will continue to be delivered in a real-time interactive format through Zoom via Canvas until the end of Semester B 2019/20.

2. Assessment. Final examinations will be conducted online during the examination period from 11 to 23 May 2020. Under exceptional circumstances where in-hall examinations have to be held, academic units will inform students accordingly. The Office of the Provost will issue guidelines to the academic units soon to provide advice on the preparation, design, and monitoring of the online final examinations. Course leaders will update students on the adjustments of assessment tasks as soon as possible, if any.

3. Course Grading Arrangements. The University will be offering students the option to apply for a change from letter grading to pass/fail grading for up to 6 credit units of courses taken in Semester B 2019/20. Details on the application process will be announced soon.

replies.msg:
To: All Bachelor’s and Associate Degree Students







Increase of GE Places for Summer Term 2020


In view of the demand of GE courses in Summer Term 2020, the University has decided to increase the capacity of some GE courses and offer additional courses. Students who are already on the waitlist will be registered into the course sections according to individual students’ position in the waitlist queue. Students may also register in courses if there are seats available.



Please check the Master Class Schedule on Tuesday, 2 June 2020 at 10:00am for any available seats and register additional GE courses as appropriate.




Academic Regulations and Records Office

Students who are already on the waitlist will be registered into the course sections according to individual students’ position in the waitlist queue. Students may also register in courses if there are seats available.



Please check the Master Class Schedule on Tuesday, 2 June 2020 at 10:00am for any available seats and register additional GE courses as appropriate.
